text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm live how I cook my perfectly pink
hamburgers do not let the photo fool you
I don't think I had the best lighting
and/or photography skills so some of
your gonna look at and say oh my god
that's rare how could you eat it like
that and some are going to look at it
and say what do you mean that's medium
well
but trust me for temperature for texture
it was a perfect perfect medium alright
so here's my method and I'm going to use
a standard 8 ounce which is a nice big
size hamburger it's about 3/4 of an inch
thick maybe close to an inch
I don't measure i salt and pepper both
sides generously i greased a skillet of
any sort here I'm using my nonstick I
also do this in cast iron usually I
preheat the pan on medium-high and when
I think it's hot and if you're not sure
you can just touch the burger to the pan
it will sizzle a little bit or if it
doesn't sizzle it's not hot and I turn
it down and I cook the entire rest of
the way on medium what I'm looking for
is the heat to come up the side so you
can kind of see how it's cooking and at
first not much is going to happen two or
three minutes later you're going to
notice that heat sort of creeping up the
side that that raw burger is going to
start turning opaque and then white and
this is going to take about five to six
minutes so right there it's about
halfway up or so I needed to go a little
past halfway so see that that's just
about perfect that not raw looking
burger it's kind of creeping up just
past halfway not quite two-thirds I
don't want to get too technical here
anyway it's not rocket surgery and again
we're not going so much on time as look
okay so at that point I'm going to flip
now the second side we can't quite do as
long so however many minutes it took you
to cook the first side I'm going to
subtract about a minute or two for the
second side so my first I took about
five minutes this side is going to take
about four and you can feel that it's
still wrong all right see how when I
push on it it just kind of pushes down
with very little resistance it feels
wrong two minutes later three minutes
later it was a little firmer to the
touch it basically sprung back and
liquid wanted to pop out of the top
that's another sign by the way you can
do that test with tongs you
probably shouldn't use your finger
because you burn yourself and then you
blame me and it will only partially be
my fault and that's it I'm going to take
those out of the pan I'm gonna let them
rest at least five minutes you're crazy
if you don't let your meat rest get your
bun ready however you're going to dress
it then dig in so there's no exact
methods but this does get you close
alright if you want to cook all the way
through bless your heart but for me it's
not the best way to eat a burger rare is
not the best way either I don't know why
people eat rare burgers you should just
eat hamburger and save yourself the
trouble by the way I would really love
to show you the rest of this burger but
I can till July 27th so stay tuned for

you're gonna be blown away so I hope
